column4:
--Stop with the unfunny jokes.
If you keep doing things like that, you'll really
be in trouble when you're actually weakened.

column3:
ここで寝ようと思ったら
人の話し声や足音は絶えねぇうえに
誰かが食ってる飯の臭いはするしで
最初は苦労するかもしれねぇな
column4:
If you're thinking of sleeping here, know this.
You'll be hearing conversation and footsteps all
through the night, and you'll catch the smell of
someone eating.
It may be tough at first.

column3:
でも、慣れるとそれが
"安心する物音"になるんだ
不思議だろ
column4:
But once you get used to it, that becomes a
"reassuring sound".
Strange, isn't it?

おい、外に出たら

準備は万端にしていけ
column4:
Hey, listen up!
Once you step outside, you'll be facing the demon
horde again.
Make sure you're fully prepared.

column3:
言っておくが、お前の心配をしてるんじゃない
アッカーシェランの心配をしてるんだ
お前には万全の状態で出発してもらわないと困る
column4:
I'll tell you this, but I'm not worried about you.
I'm worried about Acre Selund.
I need you departing in perfect condition.

column3:
ん？　何か欲しいものでもあるのか？
きっちり金を払っていくってんなら
いくらでも分けてやるよ、へへへ
column4:
Hm? What is it you desire?
If you're willing to pay, I've plenty to share
with you, hehehe.

column3:
ハハハ――
俺たちから盗もうなんて思うなよ
そうなったら、盗り戻すまでだからな
column4:
Hahaha!
Don't even think about stealing from us 'cause if
you do, we'll take it right back.

column3:
まぁ、くつろいでいけよ
セロがあんたを受け入れたんなら
俺らがどうこう言うものでもないからさぁ
column4:
Well, just relax and make yerself at home.
If Cyril's good with ya, then we've no right to
say nothing.

column3:
普段何をして暮らしてるか？
へへ、あんた面白いこと言うじゃないか
盗賊にそんなこと聞くもんじゃないよ
column4:
What do you do for a living?
Heh, you're funny.
You shouldn't ask such things to a thief.

column3:
同行する仲間が必要なのか？
俺が手配してやってもいいが――
お前が俺を信じるなら、だな
column4:
Need a companion to accompany you?
I can arrange it for you--
if you trust me.

column3:
何も盗賊を集めてきて
お前と一緒に旅をさせようってんじゃない
安心しろ
column4:
I'm not gathering a bunch of bandits to go on a
journey with you.
Don't worry.

column3:
アーシェって娘を見たか？
あの子はセロの実の娘でな――
見かけたら様子を見てやってくれ
column4:
Have you seen Ashe, Cyril's daughter?
She's not actually his biological daughter
though.
If you happen to see Ashe, keep an eye on her.

column3:
何をうろうろしてる
そこらの椅子に座ってもいいんだぞ
盗賊のねぐらなんかじゃ
落ち着いてられないってか？
column4:
What are you wandering around for?
You can sit on any chair around here, you know.
Can't relax in a den of thieves, huh?

column3:
えーっと、なに？
あたし、顔に何か付いてる？
column4:
Uhm, what?
Do I have something on my face?

column3:
あたしたちだって
アッカーシェランの人間だよ
火竜さまの恩恵を受けて生きてきてるんだから
column4:
We're people from Acre Selund too, you know.
We've been living under the blessing of the Fire
Dragon.

column3:
――ちょっと"事情"がある人だらけだけど
ええと、その――火竜さまへの気持ちは
街の人たちとちょっとも変わんないってこと！
column4:
There are a lot of people with "circumstances"
here, but well, my feelings towards Lord Fire
Dragon are no different from the people in town!

column3:
ウチの人たちって目つき悪い人、多いでしょ？
でもみんな優しい人たちなんだよ
あんまり悪く思わないで
column4:
I know our people might seem a bit intimidating
at first, with their stern expressions.
But they're all genuinely kind-hearted
individuals.
Judge them not too harshly.

column3:
うーん――
何、あたしだって悩むことくらいあるよ
column4:
Hmmm--
What? I have problems too!

column3:
物資ならいくらか持ってきてやった
何が必要か、言ってみろ
column4:
If it's supplies you require, I can bring some.
Just tell me what you need.

column3:
こんなところ近付きたくはないが
――何でも、お前らにかかってるらしいじゃねえか
物資くらいなら運んできてやる
column4:
I'd rather not be around this place...
-- But I hear it's all up to you guys, huh?
I'll at least keep you supplied.

column3:
感謝するならうちの頭領にしとけ
俺は言われて運んできてるだけだ
column4:
If you want to thank me, you should thank our
chieftain.
I only bring it as instructed.

column3:
うちの奴らだけじゃなく
ベルタんとこの奴らにも気に入られてるらしいな
あんた、こういう稼業にも向いてるんじゃないか
column4:
It seems like not only my crew but also Bertha's
lot are fond of you.
You might have a knack for this kind of work, you
know.

column3:
先に進む覚悟は――どう？
一緒に行く相手がいないなら
アタシが声かけてこようか？
column4:
Are you ready to head on?
If you don't have anyone to accompany you, I
could suggest some folks.

column3:
なるようにしかならないもんさ
あんまり気負わずにいけばいい
――なんて言っても
結局はあんたにかかってるんだけどね
column4:
What will be, will be.
Don't get too worked up.
... Even though that's what they say, in the end,
it all depends on you.

column3:
火垂れ山の中は暑いだろうけど
頭の方は冷静さを心掛けな
熱と緊張でイカれて命を落とさないように
column4:
It must be hot inside the Firefall Mountain, but
keep a cool head.
Stay your mind under the duress of heat and you
may end up keeping your life.

column3:
そうだ――
戦技を見直してから行きなよ
ユセフが相談にのってくれるからさ
column4:
That's right...
Reevaluate your combat skills before you go.
Youssef will give you advice, so consult with him.

column3:
体調と戦技、それから装備――
覚者殿には万端の状態でいていただかねば
column4:
Physical condition, combat skills, and equipment—
It is essential for the Master Arisen to be in
perfect condition.

column3:
ここでお休みになるならば<VAL PRICE_INN>です
この荒れ地で寝床を確保するために必要でして――
覚者殿、どうかご了承ください
column4:
If you wish to take a rest here, the price is
<VAL PRICE_INN>.
It is necessary to secure a place to sleep in
this barren land...
Master Arisen, please understand.

column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

寝心地がいいとはお世辞にも言えぬ寝床ですが
どうぞお休みください
体調を整えていただくことが最優先です
column4:
While I can't exactly call this bed comfortable,
please rest well.
Your well-being is our top priority, so please
take the time to recover.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column4: No

《弱化の治療》でしょうか

column4:

Because there is a limited supply of resources
for treatment, there is no choice but to ask for
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
Please, understand, and forgive me――

column3: はい

column3: いいえ
column4: No

覚者殿、申し上げにくいことですが
《弱化》されていないようです
ええ、間違いなく《弱化》されていません
column4:
Master Arisen, 'tis difficult for me to really
say, but it seems that you have not been weakened.
Yes, without a doubt.

column3:
"あの時"メガドを護りきれなかった我らです
"今"できることをやらせてください
column4:
We couldn't protect Megado back then.
Let us do what we can do now!

column3:
火垂れ山へもお供したいのは山々ですが
――我らでは足手まといになるだけでしょう
ここでお待ちしております
column4:
While we would love to accompany you to Firefall
Mountain, we fear we would only hinder your
progress.
--We shall await your return here.

column3:
突然の怪我や物資不足――
他にも、何かあった時には
すぐにこのキャンプへお戻りください
そのために我々がいるのですから
column4:
Sudden injury or lack of supplies--
If you have any other problems, please return to
this camp immediately.
That's what we're here for!

column3:
――お前さん
なかなか見どころがありそうじゃの
column4:
--You've got something special about you, I can
tell.
I'm intrigued.

column3:
その気があるならワシのとっておきを
教えてやらんでもないが
column4:
If you're interested, I could share some of my
insider knowledge with you.

column3:
海竜リンドブルムに座礁船
ここからでも浜辺の様子はよぉ見えるわい
お前さんが来る様子もな
column4:
Ship stranded on Lindwurm.
I can see the beach just fine from here.
And I can see you coming, too.

column3:
このモルトバ灯台はな、今でこそ
神殿から出る洋撃船専用みたいに
なっとるが、もっと昔の時代からあったそうじゃ
column4:
The Moltova Lighthouse now seems to be
exclusively for the ocean-bound ships leaving from
the temple, but apparently, it has been around
since ancient times.

column3:
外洋が穏やかでヒュージブルもおらず
数多の船が浜の村から出ていた時代にな
column4:
In the era when the open sea was calm and there
was no Brine, many ships used to depart
from the village on the beach.

column3:
んん？
何じゃ、わざわざこんな所に
何をしにきた、特にもてなしもできんぞ
column4:
Huh? What brings you all the way here?
Can't offer much hospitality in a place like this.

column3:
ほう――
そっちの話か、良かろう
column4:
Oh, that's what you're after.
Alright then.

column3:
ワシはルドルフォ
見ての通り灯台守じゃが、かつては白騎団で
《シールドセージ》の教官をしておった
column4:
I am Rudolfo.
As you can see, I am the lighthouse keeper.
Formerly, I used to be an Instructor of the White
Knights, teaching the ways of the Shield Sage.

column3:
お前さん、《シールドセージ》として経験を積み
護りのイロハは体得したようじゃの
column4:
Seems you've gained experience as a Shield Sage,
and mastered the basics of protection.

column3:
大盾で敵の攻撃を受けとめ、それを反撃の力たる
フォースへ転化する――
column4:
With the Greatshield, you can intercept the
enemy's attacks and convert them into the power to
counterattack--

column3:
そして、敵の注目を一身に集めることで
仲間の攻撃機会を増やす
column4:
And by drawing the enemy's attention to oneself,
increase the opportunities for your allies to
attack.

column3:
もう分かっているだろうが
その大盾は、お前さんのみを守るものにあらず
仲間のための砦でもある
column4:
You should already have grasped this.
That Greatshield is not only for your protection,
but is also a fortress for your comrades.

column3:
力量はもう十分じゃ
ワシの出す試練を乗り越え、さらなる精進を
してみんか？
column4:
Your strength is already enough.
How about overcoming the trials I present and
striving for further improvement?

column3:
よしよし
護りのイロハは体得したようじゃの
column4:
Good, good, it seems you've mastered the basics
of protection.

column3:
では、《シールドセージ》として
本格的に鍛錬を積むがよい
column4:
Then, it's time to undergo some rigorous training
as a Shield Sage!

column3:
お前さん、かなり護りの術に
長けてきたようじゃの
column4:
You're getting pretty good at the art of
self-defense, aren't you?

column3:
よし――
ではそろそろ、もう一歩踏み込んだ
技を覚えてみるか
column4:
Alright――
Then, it's about time to learn a more advanced
technique.

column3:
うむ、《シールドセージ》に興味があるのか？
――シールドセージはもともと騎士団と戦に
赴いたプリーストの一団が、防護術に特化し
開いた職と言われていてな
column4:
Ah, are you interested in the Shield Sage?
The Shield Sage is said to be a vocation that was
originally formed by a group of priests who joined
the Knights Order and specialized in defensive
magic.

column3:
もっとも大きな差は、自身の精神力だけでなく
敵が攻撃に使う力そのものを、護りの力に転化
したという点じゃ
column4:
The biggest difference is that we have converted
not only our own mental power, but also diversion
of the enemy's attack into the power to protect.

column3:
敵の攻撃を防ぎ、かつ力として吸収する大盾は
あれで呪具でもある
column4:
The Greatshield that blocks enemy attacks and
absorbs them as power also serves as a tool of
magic.

column3:
ロッドと対で使うことで
力を《フォース》として蓄積し、制御するのじゃ
――む？　ちょっと難しかったかの？
column4:
Used in conjunction with a rod, it stores and
controls power as "Force".
-- Hmm?　Shall I reiterate?

column3:
要するに、じゃ
敵の力すら利用し、己自身が皆を守る盾となる者
それがシールドセージということじゃよ
column4:
In short, a Shield Sage is someone who not only
harnesses the power of their enemies, but also
becomes a shield to protect everyone.

column3:
お前さん
《エンチャント》は使っておるか？
column4: Are you using "Enchant" abilities?

column3:
火や氷、雷、そして聖に闇
魔物どもには弱点というべき
苦手属性があることが多くてな
column4:
Fire, ice, lightning, as well as holy and dark—
many monsters have weaknesses or attributes they
are vulnerable to.

column3:
そこを突けるかどうかで、戦いの流れは
全く変わると言っても過言ではない
弱点属性をエンチャントしてやれば
味方の火力は一気に上がるじゃろう
column4:
It is not an exaggeration to say that the flow of
battle can completely change depending on whether
or not you can exploit that weakness.
By enchanting the right attribute, your allies'
firepower will increase significantly.

column3:
《フォース》に属性の力を帯びさせ
武器へ付与する
それがシールドセージのもう一つの
大きな役割じゃな
column4:
Infusing the power of enchantments from "Force"
and applying it to weapons—
that's another significant role of the Shield
Sage.

column3:
ふううむ、目を見張る成長じゃ
お前さんに、ワシのとっておきを
伝授する時がきたようだの
column4:
Hmm, your growth is truly remarkable.
It seems that the time has come for me to impart
my special knowledge to you, my dear apprentice.

column3:
《シールドセージ》の真髄とは
己自身が仲間を守る砦となること
そして戦いの行方を導く、確かな
灯台となることじゃ
column4:
The essence of the "Shield Sage" is to become a
fortress that protects one's comrades, and to be a
reliable beacon that guides the course of battle.

column3: それを心して、この技を修得するがよい
column4: Keep that in mind as you master this technique.

column3:
なんじゃお前さん
戦技についての話か？
column4:
What's on your mind, stranger?
Are you here to discuss combat skills?

column3:
そうじゃな――ならまずは――
《シールドセージ》となり
ジョブレベル１８を目指すといい
column4:
Well, then, first of all, you should become a
"Shield Sage" and aim for job level 18.

column3:
その後、神殿の訓練官――
たしかレンテンとかいったかのう
あの者から正式にワシへの修練紹介を
出してもらうがよい
column4:
After that, the temple trainer-- I think it's
Renton or something like that-- can give you a
formal introduction to my training.

column3:
その時こそ直伝の技を教えてやろう
それまではよく護り、鍛えるのじゃ
column4:
Only then will I teach you the techniques
directly.
Until then, protect and train well.

column3:
ほほぉ、シールドセージとして
なかなか励んでおるようじゃの
そのレベルであれば、より高度な技術を
学んでよい頃かもしれん
column4:
Oh, so you're working hard as a Shield Sage I see.
At your level, it might be a good time to learn
more advanced techniques.

column3:
とはいえ、急にワシが修練してやるのは
筋違いじゃな
覚者であれば神殿の訓練官――
レンテンとか言ったかのう？
column4:
That said, it wouldn't be right for me to
suddenly start training you.
If you're an Arisen, you should seek out the
Temple's Training Officer -- I believe his name
was Renton.

column3:
まずはあやつに一報を入れてから
この道を深めるかどうか
今一度考えてみるとよい
column4:
I suggest you contact that individual first and
then reconsider whether to delve further into this
path.

column3:
あらぁ、わざわざこんな所に何の用？
魔女が住んでるって噂でも
聞いてきたのかしら？　ふふふ
column4:
Oh my, what brings you all the way here?
Did you come to inquire about the rumors of a
witch residing here? Hehehe.

column3:
術士として見込みがありそうなら
特別に教えてあげてもいいわよ
column4:
If you show promise as a sorcerer, I might
consider teaching you something special.

column3:
ソーサリーと呼ばれる
今やこの地から失われゆく魔術の極意をね
あなた、興味ある？
column4:
Are you interested in learning the secrets of
Sorcery, a form of magic that has all but vanished
from this land?

column3:
魔術の真髄は森羅万象への理解
自然の中で一体となり
頭と身体で感じる事が大切なのよ
column4:
The essence of magic lies in understanding the
vastness of nature.
It is crucial to become one with nature, to feel
it with both your mind and body.

column3: あらぁ、わざわざこんな所に何の用？
column4: Oh, what are you doing all the way out here?

column3:
――あら、パトリシアからの紹介？
なら、見込みある人みたいね
column4:
Oh, Patricia sent you?
Well, it seems like you have potential.

column3:
あたくしはエメラダ、《ソーサラー》よ
大きすぎる破壊の力ゆえ
今は神殿で禁じられた術――魔術を伝えているの
column4:
I am Emerada, a "Sorcerer."
The Temple has deemed Sorcery too dangerous, they
have banished it from their teachings.
Yet, I continue to instruct those who seek to
harness its power.

column3:
世界を包む霊、質、量、法則を知り
望む力を生みだす技、その根源は
生死や世界そのものの成り立ちにまで
深く繋がっているわ
column4:
Knowledge in the spirits, essences, quantities,
and laws that envelop the world, the technique
that produces the power you seek is deeply
connected to the very foundation of life, death,
and the origins of existence itself.

column3:
ふふ、もしかしたら神殿が禁じたのは
そういう所が、例のあの学問と似ているから――
かもしれないわね
column4:
Hehe, perhaps the reason the temple forbade it is
because such knowledge cuts too close to the vein,
so to say...

column3:
激しい魔力の本流を感じ、魔法陣を練って
解き放つの――！
その快感、あなたも味わってみない？
column4:
Feel the intense flow of magickal power, weave
the spell, and unleash it—!
Wouldn't you like a taste of that?

column3:
あたくしの出す試練を見事こなせたら
《ソーサラー》への入門を認めてあげるわよ
column4:
If you can successfully overcome the trials I
present to you, I shall grant you entry into the
world of the Sorcerer.

column3:
魔術師のこと、知りたいの？
あたくし達《ソーサラー》はスペルと理律
によって万物を理解し紡ぎ、精錬するの――
column4:
Curious about Sorcerers?
We, the Sorcerers, comprehend and weave the
fabric of existence through spells and principles,
refining it to our will.

column3:
神官の術とは全く異なるものなのよ
簡単に言うと、学問に近い術体系かも
しれないわね
column4:
It's very different from the priestly arts.
Simply put, it's a system that may be closer to
academia.

column3:
世界を包むさまざまな力の法則を知り
紡ぎ、操る技なの
そしてその力は、生死や世界そのものの
成り立ちに深く繋がっているわ
column4:
It's about knowing, weaving, and manipulating the
laws of various powers that envelop the world.
And that power is deeply connected to the very
foundation of life, death, and existence itself.

column3:
魔術の多くが破壊の力として顕れるのは
そのせいかしらね？　ふふふ
column4:
I wonder if the destructive nature of many a
spell stems from the same underlying principles?
Hehehe.

column3:
どう？
少しは興味を持ってもらえたかしら
あなたに相応の実力と信頼があれば――
もっと深く教えてあげるわ
column4:
How about it?
I wonder if I've managed to pique your interest a
little.
If you have the appropriate skills and trust—

オレの十八番
column4: So, I'll teach you my specialty.

column3: 《ハンター》、弓うつ、獲物狙う
column4: The Hunter, bow drawn, aims at their prey.

column3: 剣届かないやつ、弓届く
column4:
The one who can't reach with a sword, can reach
with a bow.

column3:
矢、いくつか種類ある
知ってるか？
column4:
Arrows, there are several types.
Know about them?

column3:
固い大物狙う、矢じりに爆薬仕込む
威力強くなる
column4:
When aiming for sturdy large prey, put explosives
on arrow to make it more powerful.

column3:
他にも毒や睡眠薬、塗った矢もある
お前、選んで使え
column4:
There are also poison and sleep-inducing arrows,
and more.
You, choose and use them as you see fit.

column3:
お前、まだまだ
弓、練習もっとしろ
column4:
You, still a long way to go.
Practice the bow more.

column3:
《ハンター》続ける
ジョブレベル１８なる――
column4:
Continue as a "Hunter."
Reach job level 18—

column3:
神殿の訓練官、お前の腕認めれば
オレに紹介くる
column4:
If the temple instructor recognizes your skill,
he will introduce you.

column3:
それから教えてやる
もっと強い、速い弓
column4:
Then I will teach you.
Stronger, faster bow.

column3:
お前、レベルいい線きた
もっと強い弓そろそろ教えてやる
column4:
You, you're getting pretty good.
I'll teach you a stronger bow soon.

column3:
だけど、義理大事
お前見てきた神殿の訓練官に
挨拶してこい
column4:
But, duty is important.
Go greet the temple instructor.

column3: オレ教える、その後
column4: After that, I teach you.

column3:
長くザンドラに滞在し見聞を深めるも
未だ知れぬこと多し
column4:
Even after spending a long time in Zandora and
deepening my knowledge, there is still much I
don't know.

column3:
ザンドラが禁域と呼ばれるは
白竜と神殿の意と伝え聞く
column4:
I have heard that Zandora is called a forbidden
zone because of the White Dragon and the will of
the temple.

column3:
封じられるべき禁術に人を寄せ付けんがため
しかし、封じられるものを開こうとするもまた
人と知の性
column4:
Forbidden techniques are sealed away to prevent
people from using them.
Yet, the very nature of humanity and our thirst
for knowledge compels us to seek what's forbidden.

column3:
不慣れであれば、標の祠に向かうのがよい
さすれば、この地の探索も思いのほか
捗ろう
column4:
If you're not familiar with the area, heading
towards the shrine is a good idea to make better
progress in your exploration.

column3: ほう、何を求めここへ来たるか
column4: Oh, what brings you here?

column3:
壁に梯子に岩山にサイクロプスに
まぁ、登るってもいろいろあるけどさ
column4:
On the wall, on the ladder, on the rocky
mountain, and even the Cyclops...
Well, there are various ways to climb, you know.

column3:
あんた、何に登りたいの？
俺はある程度なんでもイケるぜ
column4:
What do you want to climb, my friend?
I can handle pretty much anything.

column3:
高いとこ最高だよな！
そのうち、ボルド鉱山の山頂目指してやろうと
思ってんだよね
column4:
Being up high is the best, isn't it?
I'm thinking of aiming for the summit of Volden
Mines someday.

column3:
真面目に登ろうとするなら
ロープとダガ―は必須でしょ
column4:
If you're serious about climbing, you'll need a
rope and a dagger.

column3:
あんたもどう？
登りのノウハウ、教えてもいいぜ
column4:
How about you?
I could teach you how to climb.

column3:
へえ――
ヘイデンのおっさんに紹介されたのか
《シーカー》のこと知りたいってか？
もちろん、歓迎するぜ
column4:
Heh--
You were introduced to me by old man Hayden?
You want to know about the "Seeker"?
Sure, you're welcome.

column3:
そうだな、《シーカー》と言えばまずは
ダガ―を使った素早い連続攻撃――
それからロープを使った
立体移動が特徴だな
column4:
Well, the "Seeker" is characterized first of all
by a quick succession of attacks using daggers--
and then by three-dimensional movement using
ropes.

column3:
オレ達にとっちゃロープは体の一部
自由に伸びる第三の手、みたいなモンさ！
column4:
For us, the rope is a part of our body, like a
third hand that extends freely!

column3:
ヒット＆アウェイ、そして何より
デカイ魔物に取りつくロマン！
column4:
Hit & Away, and above all, the romance of facing
off against colossal monsters!

column3:
まるで自分が敵を切り刻む
風にでもなったみたいで気持ちいいぞ？
column4:
It's like you're the wind chopping up your
enemies, and it feels good, doesn't it?

column3:
オレはチェスター、あらためてよろしくな
自由な《シーカー》生活を楽しんでみないか？
課題のクリア、待ってるぜ！
column4:
I'm Chester, and it's nice to meet you again.
Enjoy the freedom of the Seeker's life!
I'll be waiting for you to complete your
assignments!

column3:
よっ！　調子はどうだ？
今日も登ってるか？
column4:
Yo! How you doing?
You climbing today?

column3:
おっ！　いいねぇいいねぇ！
あんた、解ってきたみたいじゃないか
column4:
Whoa!　That's good, that's good, that's good!
You're really starting to get it, aren't you?

column3:
そうさ
《シーカー》ってのは、単に登るだけ
じゃないんだぜ
column4: Yes, "Seekers" are more than just climbers.

column3:
求めるものを手に入れるため
道の形に縛られることなく
目的を手繰り寄せる者のことなんだ
column4:
It's about those who achieve their goals,
unconstrained by the form of the path, by carving
their own way forward.

column3:
広い世界を自由に、好きなように
オレやあんたみたいにな
column4:
To roam the world freely, as one pleases, like
people who live life on their own terms.

column3:
さぁ、これからはそのロープとダガ―を
思うがまま、お前の目的めがけて
振るってやればいいさ！
column4:
Now, wield those ropes and daggers as you please,
reaching for your target however you see fit!

column3:
おぉ！
あんた、あちこち登ってるみたいじゃないか
見りゃ解るぜ
column4:
Oh!
It seems you've been climbing around quite a bit,
eh?
I can tell just by looking at you.

column3:
じゃあよ、一つ新しいコツを教えてやるよ
できるようになるまで、ちょっとばかり
練習が要るかもしれないけどな
column4:
Alright then, I'll teach you a new trick.
It might require a bit of practice until you can
do it, but don't worry.

column3:
おぉお、あんた！
気がつけば、初めて会った時とは
雰囲気が全然違うな
column4:
Oh, hey there!
I must say, you've changed a lot since the first
time we met.

column3:
よぉし、一人前の《シーカー》になったあんたに
オレの得意技を教えてやるよ
それでさらに、あんたは自由を
手に入れられるようになるはずさ
column4:
Alright, I'll teach you my special technique
since you've become a full-fledged Seeker.
With that, you should be able to attain true
freedom.

column3:
どれほどの高みを目指せるか
これからは自分との勝負になるぜ
column4:
Let's see how high you can go.
From now on, you're in a race against yourself.

column3:
ああ、オレのやってること？
《シーカー》ってんだけどさ
興味ある？
column4:
Ah, what am I doing?
I'm called a "Seeker," you know.
Are you interested?

column3:
シーカーはロープとダガ―で
険しい足場にデカイ魔物、縦横無尽に登って
走ってを追求する奴さ
column4:
The Seeker climbs the treacherous terrain with
ropes and daggers.
Scaling towering enemies with ease, chasing after
them relentlessly.

column3:
身ごなしに自信があるなら
きっと合ってると思うぜ！
column4:
If you're confident in your agility, then I'm
sure it suits you perfectly!

column3:
オレは純粋に登るのが好きだけど
速さに高さ、魔物に宝に――
何を追求するかは人次第だな
column4:
I genuinely like to climb, but speed, height,
demons, treasure--
it's up to the person to decide what they want to
pursue.

column3:
あんたがヘイデンのおっさんが認めるくらい
渓谷に詳しくなれりゃ、《シーカー》として
更なるテクも目指せると思うぜ
column4:
If you become knowledgeable about the valley to
the extent that even Hayden recognizes you, I
think you can aim for even greater techniques as a
Seeker.

column3:
でっかい魔物、見たら登りたくなるよな？
特に二本足で立ってる巨人とか
column4:
When you see a huge enemy, like a giant standing
on two legs, don't you feel the urge to climb it?

column3:
あいつら怒らせた時、よじ登って《揺さぶって》
やったらよ、面白いように体勢崩すんだよな
column4:
When you provoke them and then climb up and
"shake" them, they lose their balance in an
amusing way.

column3: スリルあるから、やってみてくれよ！
column4: It's thrilling, you should try it!

column3:
おっ！？
あんた、かなりあちこち登ってきたシーカー
みたいだな！
column4:
Oh!?
You seem like quite the Seeker, having climbed
all over the place!

column3:
――さては、ヘイデンのおっさんが言ってた
"紹介したい覚者"ってあんたのことだな？
《シーカー》のこと、もっと知りたいってなら
もちろん、歓迎するぜ！
column4:
Well, you're that Arisen Hayden was talking about.
If you want to know more about the 'Seekers,' I
definitely welcome it!

column3:
そうだな、《シーカー》と言えばまずは
ダガ―を使った素早い連続攻撃――
それからロープを使った
立体移動が特徴だよな
column4:
Well, when it comes to the "Seeker", first of
all, it's characterized by a quick succession of
attacks using daggers, and then by
three-dimensional movement using ropes.

column3:
オレ達にとっちゃロープは体の一部
自由に伸びる第三の手、みたいなモンさ！
column4:
For us, the rope is a part of our body, like a
third hand that extends freely!

column3:
ヒット＆アウェイ、そして何より
デカイ魔物に取りつくロマン！
column4:
Hit & Away, and above all, the romance of facing
off against towering foes!

column3:
技を磨いて戦場を縦横無尽に
飛び回るベテランのシーカーを目指そうぜ！
まるで自分が敵を切り刻む
風にでもなったみたいで気持ちいいぞ
column4:
Let's aim to become skilled Seekers, flying
freely across the battlefield!
It feels great, as if we've become the wind
cutting through our enemies with ease.

column3:
オレが出す課題をこなせば、
もういっちょ上のテクってヤツを
教えてやるからさ
きっちりついてこいよ？
column4:
If you can complete the tasks I assign, I'll
teach you some even higher-level techniques.
So pay close attention and follow along, okay?

column3:
なーに、あんたならできるさ！
自由のための投資ってやつだ
column4:
Hey now, you can do it! It's an investment for
freedom.

column3:
お、なになに？
オレみたいなシーカーになりたいって？
column4:
Oh, what is it?
You want to be a Seeker like me?

column3:
ま、そう焦ることはないって！
まずは１人で色々やって
思うまま体を動かしてみろよ
column4:
Well, don't be in such a hurry!
Do some things on your own first.
Move your body as the mood takes you.

column3:
そうだな、《シーカー》として
ジョブレベルが１８になったら
もういっちょ上のテクを教えてやるぜ
column4:
Yeah, once you reach Job Level 18 as a Seeker,
I'll teach you another higher-level technique.

column3:
おっと、その前に神殿にいる訓練官に
挨拶を忘れるなよ
ちゃんと紹介されてからなら
いくらでも教えてやるからさ
column4:
Oh, before that, don't forget to greet the
Trainer in the Temple.
Once you've been properly introduced, I'll be
happy to teach you as much as you want.

column3:
おお、あんた結構登ってるみたいだな！
な、シーカーとして次のステップに
進んでみる気は無いか？
そろそろ更なるテクが欲しい頃だろ？
column4:
Oh, it seems like you've been climbing quite a
bit!
Well, as a Seeker, do you have any intention of
taking the next step?
It's about time you wanted to learn some more
advanced techniques, right?

column3:
その気があるなら、神殿にいる訓練官に
ちゃんと紹介もらってくれよ
でなきゃ、ヘイデンのおっさんや神殿から
小言いわれるんだわ、オレ
column4:
If you're serious about it, get an introduction
from the Training Officer at the Temple.
Otherwise, I'll get an earful from old Hayden and
the Temple staff for bringing you here
unannounced.

column3:
ミスリウ森林深部に
ほとんど人はおりません
column4:
Deep within Mysree Grove, there are hardly any
people.

column3:
私はここで一人、静かな森に身を任せ
祠を守っております
column4:
Alone in this place, I entrust myself to the
serenity of the forest, protecting the shrine.

column3:
岸辺の小屋には立ち寄られましたか？
イヴァンという狩人が暮らしております
column4:
Have you stopped by the hut on the shore?
A hunter named Ivan lives there.

column3:
あの方は少し会話が不器用ですが
素晴らしい弓の名手
きっと覚者さまの力となってくれるでしょう
column4:
That man is a bit clumsy in conversation, but he
is a wonderful bow master, and I'm sure he will be
a great help to you, Ser Arisen!

column3:
この森には、古き民――
エルフに縁ある遺跡が点在しています
優しく美しい、今なお息吹ある建物です
column4:
In this forest, there are scattered ruins with a
connection to the ancient people - the elves.
They are gentle and beautiful buildings that
still have a breath of life.

column3:
中に入った者いわく
ところどころに、不思議な青い床石があり
その意味を理解しなければ
先に進むことができないのだとか――
column4:
According to those who have entered inside, there
are mysterious blue floor stones scattered
throughout, and it seems that one cannot proceed
without understanding their meaning.

column3:
このような祠でも、旅の疲れを取るくらいなら
できましょう、辺境ゆえ<VAL PRICE_INN>ほど
ご負担いただきますが
column4:
Even in a humble shrine like this, we can provide
some respite from your travels.
However, due to our remote location, we cannot
offer the same level of comfort.
Therefore, we must ask for a modest fee of <VAL PRICE_INN>
.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
このような木々の迷路――
そのまた奥までご苦労さまです
よくぞ迷わずにいらっしゃいました
それとも――迷ったあげくにここへ？
column4:
This labyrinth of trees... And you've made it all
the way to the back.
My compliments. You must have a good sense of
direction.
Or perhaps... you got lost and stumbled upon this
place?

column3:
いずれにしても
私が貴方さまのお役に立てましょう
column4: Either way, I am at your service.

column3:
私はクリスティーヌ
ミスリウの、深き森のエリアマスターで
ございます
column4:
I am Christine, the Area Master of the deep
forest of Mysree.

column3:
ミスリウ深部には――
イニアス湖を中心として、エルフに由来する
遺跡が数多くあります
お時間が許すならば、どうぞお訪ねください
column4:
In the depths of Mysree, there are numerous ruins
that originated from the elves, centered around
Lake Inias.
If you have the time, please feel free to visit.

column3:
しかし森はかつてないほど騒がしく
また獣たちも騒いでおります
場合によっては、覚者さまを頼りと
させていただくこともあるでしょう
column4:
However, the forest is more noisy than ever
before, and the animals are also making a
commotion.
Depending on the situation, we may have to rely
on the Arisen for assistance.

column3:
どうか、それをお心に留めおきください
森はいつでも貴方さまを歓迎いたします
column4:
Please keep that in mind.
The forest welcomes you as always.

column3:
ささやかながら、貴方さまの
来訪時にお納めできる
品を用意いたしました
column4:
Modest as they may be, I have prepared offerings
for your arrival.

column3:
これからもどうかこの地へ
お立ち寄りください
column4: I hope you will continue to visit these grounds.

column3:
覚者さま、イニアス湖北のほとりに
《密猟者のキャンプ》があるのは
ご存知でしょうか
column4:
Ser Arisen, do you happen to know that there is a
"Poachers' Camp" on the shores of Lake Inias?

column3:
そこに出入りする者達は、獣のみならず
人をも狩りの対象にする、悪しき者達です
column4:
Those who enter and leave that place are wicked
people who hunt not only beasts, but also people.

column3:
どうぞ周囲を散策する時は
ご注意ください
column4: Please take care when you are about.

column3:
覚者さま、お願いがございます
エルフの遺跡の一つ
通称《蒼葉のテラス》についてなのですが――
column4:
Master Arisen, I have a favor to ask.
It's about one of the elven ruins, commonly known
as "Greenleaf Terrace"...

column3:
あの遺跡は手つかずの姿を保つため
入り口を封じていたのです
column4:
The entrance was sealed to maintain its untouched
state.

column3:
しかし、その一角にグリフィンが住みつき
周囲を狩り場にするようになってしまいました
column4:
However, a griffin has taken up residence in one
of the corners and has turned the surrounding area
into a hunting ground!

column3:
そのせいで、ディナン深層林へ続く山道の
ガレキ撤去作業も滞っているようなのです
column4:
Due to that, the removal of debris on the
mountain path leading to the Deenan Woods is also
being delayed.

column3:
入り口は開放いたします
どうか、その対処を頼めないでしょうか
column4:
We will open the entrance.
Please, can you take care of that for us?

column3:
覚者さま
湖の西側、《イニアス湿地帯》にて
ブルーニュート達の中に、より強力で
人を脅かす者が現れたそうです
column4:
Arisen, it seems that a more powerful and
menacing foe has appeared among the Blue Newts in
the western side of the lake, in the Inias
Wetlands.

column3:
コバルト色の電光を纏ったトカゲ――
イヴァンも注意するよう言っておりました
column4:
Lizards adorned in cobalt lightning—
Ivan also advised to be wary of them.

column3:
どうか、近くを通る時は警戒を
そして可能であれば退治をお願いいたします
column4:
Please, exercise caution when passing by nearby.
And if possible, I kindly request that you
exterminate them.

column3:
覚者さま
かような深き森にある私どもへのお心遣い
感謝しきれるものではありません
ありがとうございます
column4:
Arisen, your kindness in reaching out to us who
dwell in these deep woods is beyond our capacity
to express.
Thank you.

column3:
また、ささやかではございますが
お納めできる品を良質なものに
させて頂きました
column4:
Furthermore, although it may be modest, we have
made sure to provide high-quality items for your
humble offering.

column3: どうか、今後ともよろしくお願いいたします
column4:
Pray, we stand grateful for your continued
efforts.

column3:
覚者さま、エルフの地《ディナン深層林》に
続く山道が開通いたしました
column4:
Master Arisen, the mountain path leading to the
Elven lands, "Deenan Woods," has been cleared.

column3:
覚者さまが、魔物を退治してくださったお陰で
ガレキ撤去作業の進捗が
良くなったそうです
column4:
Thanks to the efforts of Master Arisen, who
defeated the enemies, the progress of the debris
removal work has improved.

column3: 私から、あらためてお礼申し上げます
column4: I would like to express my gratitude once again.

column3:
さらに深き森、エルフ達の故郷を
どうぞご自身の目で確かめて来て下さい
ディナン山道は森林の最南部にございます
column4:
Please venture out and see the deeper forest, the
homeland of the elves, with your own eyes.
The Deenan Mountain Road is located at the
southernmost part of the forest.

column3:
覚者さま
イニアス湖東北にある《名もなき廃村》にて
おそろしき恨みの声を聞いたと
イヴァンから報せがありました
column4:
Arisen, I have received a report from Ivan that
he heard a voice of terrible hatred in the
"Nameless Deserted Village" located northeast of
Lake Inias.

column3:
あの方は、魔物や獣にはお強いのですが
幽霊、亡霊の類は大変苦手のご様子――
column4:
That man is strong against demons and beasts, but
he is very bad with ghosts and spirits--

column3:
どうか、イヴァンに代わり
亡者の類がさまよい出ることあらば
浄化いただけないでしょうか
column4:
Pray, for Ivan's sake, purify any undead
creatures that might emerge, won't you?

column3:
覚者さま
この森にとって、あなたはすでに大事な方
column4:
Master Arisen.
To this forest, you are already an important
figure.

column3: そして、私にとっても――
column4: And, for me as well...

column3:
あなたの尊き行いが
レスタニアのすべてに行きわたりますよう
column4: May your noble deeds reach all of Lestania.

column3:
私も、可能な限りの支援にて
あなたのお役に立ちたいと思います
どうぞこれからも、この森へおいで下さい
column4:
I, too, will do my best to support and be of help
to you.
Please continue to visit this forest from now on.

column3:
覚者さま、少し前
この森に白きキメラが姿を現したのです
column4:
Arisen, a while ago, a Chimera white as snow
appeared in these woods.

column3:
おそらく、あれは森小人達が聖獣と
崇める恐ろしの魔獣
《白獅子アルバス》――
column4:
Perhaps it's the dreaded demonic beast that the
forest dwarves worship as a holy beast,
《White Lion Albus》----.

column3:
放置したならば、この森のみならず
リンウッドにまで被害をもたらす
かもしれません
column4:
If left unchecked, it could cause damage not only
to this forest but also to Lynwood.

column3:
森の奥から姿を現したかの獣を
幸いにもイヴァンが撃退してくれました
column4:
Fortunately, Ivan was able to repel the beast as
it appeared from deep within the forest.

column3:
そして今獣が居るのは、《霊泉のテラス》奥
――《聖獣の間》
そこで力を蓄えている様子
column4:
And now, the beast is here, deep within the
Sacred Spring Terrace - the Lair of the Holy
Beast.
It seems to be gathering its strength there.

column3:
貴方さまにも魔獣の封じ込めに
ご助力いただけないでしょうか
column4: We are in need of your aid to quell the beast.

column3:
覚者さま、急いでお伝えしなければ
ならないことがあるのです
column4:
Master Arisen, there is something urgent that you
must know.

column3:
ディナン山道の手前、森の南部にて
恐るべき巨人が姿を現したのです
column4:
Just before the Deenan Mountain Road, in the
southern part of the forest, a fearsome Giant has
appeared.

column3:
その巨人の名は《ヨトン》
ハンターを襲い、多くの覚者を亡きものにした
残忍なモルトロールです
column4:
The name of that giant is "Jotun."
It is a cruel Mole Troll that attacks hunters and
has claimed the lives of many Arisen.

column3:
森のため、《ヨトン》の討伐を――！
どうかわたしからのこの依頼
お聞き入れくださいませ
column4:
For the sake of the forest, we must defeat Jotun!
Please accept my request!

column3:
《弱化の治療》ですね、承りました
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>ほどご負担いただきますが
column4:
I understand that you would like to receive the
procedure for "Treat Weakness."
It will incur a fee of <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
あら、覚者さまは《弱化》ではありませんね
治療の必要はないようです
column4:
Oh, Master Arisen, you are not weakened.
There is no need for treatment.

column3:
覚者さま、あなたはこの深き森にとっても
大事なお方
どうぞお体の疲れを取っていって下さい
column4:
Master Arisen, you are a very important person to
this forest.
Please take the time to rest and rejuvenate your
body.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
ようこそ標の祠へ
お待ちしておりました覚者さま
column4:
Welcome to the Shrine.
We have been eagerly awaiting your arrival,
Master Arisen.

column3:
覚者さま、この深き森に置かれた《辺境の礎》も
このたび全て解放されたそうでございます
column4:
Master Arisen, it seems that all the "Sub
Portcrystals" placed in this deep forest have been
released at this time.

column3:
《辺境の礎》はイヴァンの山小屋の近くにも
置かれているとのこと
column4:
It is said that "Sub Portcrystals" are also
placed near Ivan's Lodge.

column3:
貴方さまの訪れを、きっとイヴァンも喜ぶはず――
ぜひ、お時間の許す際には
お顔を見せに行ってやってください
column4:
Surely Ivan will be pleased to see you.
Prithee, whenever you have the time, pay him a
visit.

column3:
あの無愛想な顔の下で、
あの方も貴方さまのことを
ずいぶん気に入っているようなのです
column4:
Even under that gruff demeanor, it seems he has
taken a liking to you!

column3:
覚者さま、今日は折り入って
ご相談したいことがございます
column4:
Arisen, there is something I would like to
discuss with you today.

column3:
イニアス湖の近辺、南の方角に
霞んだような人影が現れたと
イヴァンから報告がありました
column4:
In the southern vicinity of Lake Inias, a hazy
figure has emerged, as reported by Ivan.

column3:
あの方は幽霊、亡霊の類が大の苦手とのこと――
それ以降、あの辺りには
近寄れないようなのです
column4:
He doesn't do well with ghosts or spirits--
and since then, he won't go near that area!

column3:
どうか、イヴァンに代わり
この人影を打ち払ってはいただけないでしょうか
column4:
Prithee, in Ivan's stead, could you kindly
dispatch this figure?

column3:
詳しくご説明いたしますので
ご出発の前には再度、私にお声掛けください――
column4:
Please call upon me again before you depart, and
I will offer a thorough explanation.

column3:
ここからディナン深層林へと進む途中に
新しく見つかりました《霧幻のテラス》――
column4:
On the way to the depths of the Deenan Woods, a
new discovery has been made - the "Misty Illusion
Terrace".

column3:
中から冷気が漏れ出でてくるような
不思議な遺跡です
冷たい霧に覆われていたせいで
今まで見つからなかったのかもしれません
column4:
It is a mysterious ruin from which cold air leaks
out.
Perhaps it remained undiscovered until now
because it was covered in a freezing mist.

column3:
何か未知の危険があるかと思い
封鎖してまいりましたが、貴方さまならば
中を調べることも可能かと――
column4:
I have sealed it, as I thought there might be
some unknown danger.
But if it is you, Ser, it may be possible to
examine the inside...

column3:
足を踏み入れられる際は
くれぐれもご注意くださいませ――
column4: Upon entering, please remain cautious――

column3:
覚者さま、度々申し訳ございませんが
今回もお力をお借りできないでしょうか――
column4:
Master Arisen, I apologize for the frequent
inconvenience, but would it be possible to borrow
your strength once again?

column3:
実は先日、突如としてこの祠の前に
ミストドレイクが現れたのです
column4:
In fact, the other day, a Mist Drake suddenly
appeared in front of this shrine!

column3:
幸い、イヴァンが訪れている時だったので
あの方が応戦してくださり
事無きを得ましたが――
column4:
Fortunately, it was when Ivan was visiting.
He graciously fought it back, and we were able to
avoid any harm.

column3:
退けられた竜は、《霧幻のテラス》へと
去っていったとのこと
column4:
The repelled dragon has retreated to "Misty
Illusion Terrace."

column3:
どうか、竜が再びこの祠を
襲うことのないよう
あの遺跡内への封じ込めに
ご協力いただけないでしょうか
column4:
Prithee, could you lend your assistance in
sealing off the ancient ruins so that the dragon
will not attack this shrine again?

column3:
覚者さま
この森にとって、あなたはすでに大事な方――
column4:
Master Arisen.
To this forest, you are already an important
figure.

column3: そして、私にとっても――
column4: And, for me as well...

column3:
あなたの尊き行いが
レスタニアのすべてに行きわたりますよう
column4: May your noble deeds reach all of Lestania.

column3:
あなたのお役に立てるよう
私も最大限の支援をお約束いたしましょう
どうぞこれからも、この森へおいでください
column4:
I will ensure that I support you to the best of
my abilities.
Please do not hesitate to return to this forest
in the future.

column3:
覚者さま
この森にとって、あなたはすでに大事な方
column4:
Master Arisen.
To this forest, you are already an important
figure.

column3: そして、私にとっても――
column4: And, for me as well...

column3:
あなたの尊き行いが
レスタニアのすべてに行きわたりますよう
column4: May your noble deeds reach all of Lestania.

column3:
かような深き森にある私どもへの
お心遣い、感謝しきれるものではありません
ありがとうございます
column4:
Master Arisen.
Your kindness in reaching out to us who dwell in
these deep woods is beyond our capacity to
express.
Thank you.

column3:
覚者さま
数々のご協力、痛み入ります
column4:
Master Arisen,
We are deeply grateful for your numerous
contributions.

column3:
覚者さま
ここを訪れて下さり――嬉しく存じます
column4:
Master Arisen,
I am delighted that you have come to visit.

column3:
何かできることはと思い
この品を用意しました
気に入って頂けると良いのですが――
column4:
I have prepared this item, hoping that there is
something I can do.
I hope you will like it...

column3:
覚者さま、これをお持ちください
イヴァンがあなたにと用意してくれたものです
column4:
Master Arisen, please bring this with you.
It is something that Ivan has prepared for you.

column3:
あの無愛想な方が、にこにことして
持ってきてくれました
column4: That unsociable man brought it to me with a smile!

column3:
覚者さま、これをお持ちください
わずかでも旅の助けとなりましょう
column4:
Master Arisen, please bring this with you.
I hope it can help you, even just a little bit.

column3:
白竜様が貴方様を覚者としたは
レスタニアにとって大いなる僥倖――
column4:
It is a great fortune for Lestania that the White
Dragon has recognized you as an Arisen, my Lord.

column3:
いえ、白竜様は見抜かれておいでだった
のかもしれませぬ
貴方様の、"理の器"たる可能性を
column4:
No, perhaps the Lord White Dragon had foreseen it
all along...
The possibility of you being the "vessel of
order."
